adrFormatAddress: 4059 Broadway, New York, NY 10032-1516, USA

editorialSummary.text: Simple eatery serving Chinese & Latin-American dishes, from beef lo mein to chicharrones de pollo.

originalText.text: A chino latino traditional. Good menu and prices. Great to have a meal with friends

text.text: A chino latino traditional. Good menu and prices. Great to have a meal with friends

originalText.text: I don’t understand the hype about this place. The food seems like decent quality but is very bland. I’ve tried them several times and each time I walk away feeling like I barely could taste any flavor. Even in a dish like eggplant in garlic sauce you could barely taste any garlic and typically this is a very flavorful dish. I think one of the reasons they do so well in the heights is cause we generally only have hole in the wall Chinese spots so by comparison this seems better but really it’s not.

originalText.text: My family has been eating at Dinastia for YEARS. They have the best Asian fusion food. Very similar to Flor de Mayo. Everything I’ve tried here does not disappoint. Love this place.

text.text: My family has been eating at Dinastia for YEARS. They have the best Asian fusion food. Very similar to Flor de Mayo. Everything I’ve tried here does not disappoint. Love this place.

originalText.text:
This review is based on food delivery only, I have not dined in their restaurant yet.

This spot always makes the best chicken crackling with their fried rice. Their packaging is well appreciated, they try their best to keep the chicken crispy while in a take out bag.

I recently ordered the chicken chunks with bone, I would skip that and just get the crackling boneless chicken, the beef fried rice is also great

I want to order their other dish next time to try it out

text.text:

originalText.text:
I’ve lived a block away for the past 5 yrs and it’s always kind of been hit or miss. When it hits, I have this feeling of “never going anywhere else.”

The most recent miss was so bad, I had to say something.

I placed my $75 order on GrubHub because I couldn’t get in touch with the restaurant. After placing the order, I realized I didn’t ask for extra duck sauce. I tried calling for the next 30 min as GrubHub wasn’t allowing me to add the adjustment to my order.

Nothing.

The food finally gets here, 3 packs of duck sauce, which I guess is my fault.

But man, we could’ve really used it. The fried rice was burnt and flavorless. The sesame chicken was also very dry. The wonton soup I ordered was some other thing I hadn’t ordered, also flavorless. The eggrolls were somehow both dry and soggy at the same time. Dry on the outside and complete mush on the inside. My guess is that it was fried too hot so it looked good to go but was not.

We also ordered a kung pao chicken but didn’t even open it because everything was so bad.

We tried calling the restaurant several times. Someone finally answered but in the middle of talking, they put the phone down and left us on hold, listening to their conversations for 10-15 min while we were also on hold waiting for GrubHub.

I reached out because we didn’t want our money back, we just wanted an edible dinner…. Which never happened. It’ll be a tough time trying to convince the Mrs to eat here again. Which is a shame. We took my mom to the UWS location a few weeks back and we LOVED it. It’s what made me want to revisit my home location again.

Pretty bummed about all this.
